intro: Daubenya, commonly known as the "false lily," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Agavaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Daubenya preussii, which is native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their rosettes of thick, fleshy leaves and their showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer. Daubenya is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers.
